ghostPage.plaintext:
Help build a new civic architecture for the digital world 
Join the growing set of communities helping to develop and promote the
Distributed Social Networking Protocol (DSNP). 

Our Forums will connect you with other developers building new services and apps
on top of DSNP. 

Forums [https://forums.projectliberty.io/]All our work is managed through open
source processes and available through GitHub repositories. 

GitHub [https://github.com/LibertyDSNP]We welcome all contributors. Do you have
an idea for a feature improvement? Want to report and help fix a bug you found
or suggest useful new documentation? Let us know!

As a relatively new project, we're moving quickly in a quasi-"rocket ship"
[https://opentechstrategies.com/archetypes-files/open-source-archetypes-v2.pdf#section*.10] 
mode to get our open source technologies to market, so we don't yet have a
fantastic onboarding process and set of first bugs. To get started, we encourage
you to read the Contribution Guidelines to understand our co-development
conventions and to read our Code of Conduct to understand the supportive
community environment we strive to create. As always, please ask any questions
in our Forums.

Contribution Guidelines
[https://github.com/LibertyDSNP/meta/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md]Code of Conduct
[../code-of-conduct]
ghostPage.html:
Help build a new civic architecture for the digital world

Join the growing set of communities helping to develop and promote the Distributed Social Networking Protocol (DSNP).

Our Forums will connect you with other developers building new services and apps on top of DSNP.

Forums

All our work is managed through open source processes and available through GitHub repositories.

GitHub

We welcome all contributors. Do you have an idea for a feature improvement? Want to report and help fix a bug you found or suggest useful new documentation? Let us know!

As a relatively new project, we're moving quickly in a quasi-"rocket ship" mode to get our open source technologies to market, so we don't yet have a fantastic onboarding process and set of first bugs. To get started, we encourage you to read the Contribution Guidelines to understand our co-development conventions and to read our Code of Conduct to understand the supportive community environment we strive to create. As always, please ask any questions in our Forums.

Contribution GuidelinesCode of Conduct
